result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew H. Rudolph was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misappropriate ID Info - Avoid Penalty [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain fulltime employment, school, or combination of the two or if not, perform 10 hours community service per week.
No contact with D.H. unless he consents to contact and authorized by agent.

Assessment, treatment, and counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept.
NO days jail credit if revoked.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been faxed to the probation office.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew H. Rudolph

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Matthew H. Rudolph
Current: 2909 E Park Ave, c/o Chippewa Valley Corr Inst, Chippewa Falls, WI 54729 United States  (Effective: 07-16-2015)
Prior: 2703 Jelinek Avenue  #2, Weston, WI 54476
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk Marisa. 
Case Called: 10:21 am 
State appears by ADA Chad Minder; Deft appears in person, in custody with Atty Kat Jackan. 

WAIVER OF PRELIMINARY HEARING. 
Waiver of Prelim. filed. 
Court questions deft as to waiver. 
Court finds waiver freely and voluntarily made. 
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial. 
Information filed. 

PLEA HEARING. 
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. VRCW. 
PLEA: Ct. 1 (Identity Theft/Repeater)>>GUILTY. 
COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 
Argument re: sentencing. Def makes statement. 
COURT ORDERS: SWH for 3 years probation to run consecutive to sentence in 13CF632 - CONDITIONS: assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; no contact with D.H. unless he consents to contact and authorized by agent; maintain fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the 2 or if not, perform 10 hours community service per week; payment of court costs. 
COURT remits DNA surcharge. 
COURT finds def is entitled to NO days jail credit if revoked. 

Adj: 10:43 am
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 11, 2014 at 10:10 am.
Status conference on October 21, 2014 at 08:50 am.
and Demand for Discovery and Inspection
Pre-trial conference on September 24, 2014 at 09:00 am.
